Food & Dining Bars & Drinks Everything you need to know about Bunny Slope, the bar with a hot tub in the middle 
The Fifty/50 Restaurant Group has opened a ski-lodge-themed bar with a hot tub in the basement of the Acme Hotel. Adam Lukach at least 48 hours in advance. Group size is capped at 18 people; considering the size and layout, you'd be more comfortable with about 10 friends, but there are price minimums to be met, so hey â€” the more the merrier to divide the cost. The space is rented in two-hour blocks at $150 per session, nonrefundable, and there's a $75-per-hour tab minimum Sunday to Wednesday that rises to $125 per hour Thursday to Saturday. Bunny Slope Kristan Lieb / Chicago Tribune 
The Freezeling, a frozen Alsatian riesling, is one of the cocktails designed to get you in a ski-lodge mood. 
The Freezeling, a frozen Alsatian riesling, is one of the cocktails designed to get you in a ski-lodge mood. (Kristan Lieb / Chicago Tribune) 
All guests must sign liability-release forms, Hetter said, and the bar uses plasticware instead of glassware. 
The drink menu features a quartet of fun frozen cocktails, including the Freezeling, a frozen Alsatian riesling, and the Apres Ski, a Wendy's-Frosty-imitator with blond rum, creme de cacao and Averna. There's also an Alpine-inspired selection of beer and wine from regions such as Alsace in France, Northern Italy, Austria and Germany. 
"It's mostly a low-proof menu, 'cause it gets pretty hot in here," Hetter said. "But as we go along, I'll see what people like to drink, and we'll tweak it from there." 
Bunny Slope, 15 E. Ohio St., www.bunnyslopechicago.com
